alert.note: Alert for North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 6:27AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern St. Louis and northwestern Lake Counties through 700 AM CDT... At 627 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Winton, to Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, to 6 miles east of Fall Lake, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Basswood Lake around 635 AM CDT. Snowbank Lake around 640 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Ensign Lake, Lake Two, Gabbro Lake, Greenstone Lake, Ojibway Lake, Crooked Lake, Fourtown Lake and Knife Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake
